Seven of the top 10 most valued Indian firms added Rs 29,779.54 crore in market valuation last week, with Reliance Industries stealing the show with maximum gain.Reliance Industries Ltd., (RIL) regained the status of the country's most valued firm, overtaking Tata Group's Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) in market capitalisation after a gap of two months.
















Other gainers in the list were HDFC Bank, ITC, HDFC, State Bank of India (SBI), Hindustan Unilever (HUL) and Infosys, while TCS, Maruti Suzuki India and ONGC suffered losses in the week ended Friday.Reliance’s valuation soared Rs 15,349.34 crore to Rs 4,66,599.69 crore.The market cap of ITC surged Rs 5,527.06 crore to Rs 3,77,601.40 crore and that of HDFC Bank jumped Rs 2,710.1 crore to Rs 4,31,189 crore.

title: Seven Of Top 10 Most Valued Firms Add Rs 29,779 Crore In Market Capitalisation
